resources.string: The opening of the theater took place on 16 December 1899. In 1929 he settled here Theatre of the Working Youth (TRAM). A few months later, a graduate of the Moscow Theatre Institute (later GITIS), directed by Anna Nesterova founded the Youth Theatre. After the war, in a building on Freedom Square received a registration Rostov theater comedy, transformed in 1957 in the Youth Drama Theatre. Lenin Komsomol. The official date of the creation of Youth Theater of the Lenin Komsomol considered to February 23, 1964, the first premiere - the play "Chapa—ënok". Religious performances were such plays as "Hamlet" by William Shakespeare, "Three Sisters" by Anton Chekhov, "Dogs" A.Chutko, L.Sergienko, "Pugachev" Yesenin. The best performances of the theater saw the audience in Germany, France, Denmark, Italy, Mexico, Poland, Turkey, Japan and other countries. In 1997, the theater received the title of Academic, and in 2001 - became known as the Rostov-on-Don Regional Academic Theatre for Youth.

This returns the viewer to play the romantic 50s. Sea surf, steamers lights, forever young, sunny Odessa and sounding above all this voice Utesova "... in the Black Sea ...". The action develops in the maelstrom of acute, ingenious jokes, funny transshipments where young heroes dream of a boundless sea open spaces, trials of friendship and love.

How can a declaration of love to express their feelings and emotions, without saying a word? There are many different ways, but the most sensual and soulful of them - it is plastic body. Dance language is universal - it is clear to any person, regardless of gender, age, nationality or status. Dance does not tolerate hypocrisy, only after you will understand and will live every emotion and energy of each movement, you can feel the ease and love, the state of mind, when you want to fly, run and do not stop when you want to hug a loved one, and will not let go. Plunge into this storm of emotions easily - we need only take a deep breath and feel the atmosphere of love and temptation.

The play is a parable, which tells about the thin line between good and evil, about the dangerous proximity of love and death. The fact that people are sometimes more violent to each other than animals. And animals, on the other hand, are capable of self-sacrifice for the sake of those who are dear to them.
